intro: Sidalcea malviflora subsp. dolosa, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada checkerbloom, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to lavender flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open areas such as meadows and streambanks. Its subspecific name, *dolosa*, refers to its preference for rocky or gravelly habitats.
